subclassFeature.name: Circle of Pheromones
entries: Druids of the Circle of Pheromones are captivating envoys of the natural world. Comfortable with navigating through royal courts and city politics alike, they enhance their diplomatic skills with a primal form of communication that predates speech: the language of fragrances.

subclassFeature.name: Aroma Spells
entries: Your magic sways hearts and minds using the myriad scents of nature. You learn an {@filter enchantment cantrip|spells|level=0|school=E} of your choice, and choose an {@filter enchantment spell|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5;6;7;8;9|school=E} to gain access to. Whenever you reach an odd level in this class, you choose another enchantment spell to gain access to, and can change one of the spells granted by this feature.

Each spell must be of a level that you can prepare as a druid. They count as druid spells for you, and you always have them prepared, but they don't count against the total number of spells you prepare each day.

subclassFeature.name: Enchanting Haze
entries: As an action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape feature to radiate invisible, undetectable pheromones in an aura with a 15-foot radius.

The aura lasts a number of hours equal to half your druid level. It ends early if you dismiss it (no action required), are {@condition incapacitated}, die, or use this feature again. While this aura is active, you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Fragrant Appeal
entries: As a bonus action, you can force a creature within your Enchanting Haze to succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition charmed} by you until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Natural Diplomacy
entries: You can use your Wisdom modifier in place of your Charisma modifier when making Charisma checks, and gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}.

subclassFeature.name: Beguiling Scents
entries: Your fragrance confuses others using mimicry and misdirection. While your Enchanting Haze is active, you can cast {@spell disguise self} at will, without expending a spell slot. The spell ends early if your Enchanting Haze ends.

Additionally, immediately before an enemy creature you can see makes an attack roll or starts to cast a spell, you can use your reaction to apply olfactory camouflage on a creature of your choice within your Enchanting Haze. The chosen creature becomes {@condition invisible} until the end of its next turn or until it attacks or casts a spell.
Once you use this reaction, you can't use it again until you reactivate your Enchanting Haze.

subclassFeature.name: Universal Allure
entries: The pheromones that you radiate transcend words and boundaries, letting you speak telepathically to any creatures of your choice within your Enchanting Haze. Each creature understands you regardless of the language you speak, and can telepathically reply to you in a similar way if you allow the creature to do so.

When you cast {@spell disguise self}, or cast an {@filter enchantment spell|spells|school=E} that only affects or targets the creatures that you can speak telepathically to, you can ignore the spell's verbal and somatic components, as well as any material components that lack a cost and aren't consumed by it.

subclassFeature.name: Lingering Fragrance
entries: Once the scent of your magic takes hold, it's easy to succumb to it further. Whenever a creature that is {@condition charmed} by you makes a saving throw against your enchantment spells or your Fragrant Appeal, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the saving throw.

When you activate your Enchanting Haze, you can use your Fragrant Appeal on any number of creatures. Each affected creature is {@condition charmed} by you until the end of your Enchanting Haze. A creature can make another Wisdom saving throw against the effect each time it takes damage. On a success, the effect ends.
